538ce0cc-e32f-4fb4-a4ad-3b9d3af70bbb.description: The earner of this badge works directly with clients either via phone, text, chat or in-person to provide mediated information and referral systems navigation with a specialization within the aging/disabilities sector. The earner is able to establish rapport, conduct an assessment, provide an informed choice of referrals, engage in follow-up and be capable of providing advocacy or crisis intervention if required.
538ce0cc-e32f-4fb4-a4ad-3b9d3af70bbb.name: Community Resource Specialist - Aging and Disabilities

issuer.summary: issued by Alliance of Information and Referral Systems

entity.name: Alliance of Information and Referral Systems

badge_template_activities.title: Submit evidence of 10 documented hours of I&R training/professional development.
Successfully pass the AIRS proctored exam.
Candidates must follow the AIRS Ethical Principles

6f589293-03c6-49cd-ad0d-43b3657f6c8a.description: This badge signifies that its owner has secured and maintained AIRS Certification. This credential demonstrates their ability to work directly with clients either via phone, text, chat or in-person to provide mediated information and referral systems navigation. The earner is able to establish rapport, conduct an assessment, provide an informed choice of referrals, engage in follow-up and is capable of providing advocacy or crisis intervention if required.
6f589293-03c6-49cd-ad0d-43b3657f6c8a.name: Certified Community Resource Specialist

issuer.summary: issued by Alliance of Information and Referral Systems

entity.name: Alliance of Information and Referral Systems

badge_template_activities.title: Submit evidence of 10 documented hours of I&R training/professional development.
Successfully pass the AIRS proctored exam.
Candidates must follow the AIRS Ethical Principles

63068db6-b42e-4c01-8ac5-dec10da81963.description: The earner of this badge curates resource databases for the communities they serve and has demonstrated knowledge and expertise in the gathering, organizing, indexing and dissemination of information about programs/services and the organizations that provide them within the sphere of health, social and community services.
63068db6-b42e-4c01-8ac5-dec10da81963.name: Community Resource Specialist - Database Curator

issuer.summary: issued by Alliance of Information and Referral Systems

entity.name: Alliance of Information and Referral Systems

badge_template_activities.title: Submit  documented hours of training/professional development within the sector.
Successfully pass the AIRS proctored exam.
Candidates must follow the AIRS Ethical Principles

e6a147a3-637e-4267-a07b-d6df284034ae.description: The Alliance of Information and Referral Systems is the professional membership association for community Information and Referral (I&R) serving the nonprofit and government sectors. AIRS is the driving force behind the delivery of quality I&R services and the sole source for standards, program accreditation and practitioner certification for the I&R sector.
e6a147a3-637e-4267-a07b-d6df284034ae.name: AIRS Platinum Member

issuer.summary: issued by Alliance of Information and Referral Systems

entity.name: Alliance of Information and Referral Systems

badge_template_activities.title: All AIRS memberships are for a year and need annual renewal on January 1st

dcdddb46-935d-4fd9-9991-6d7c1b11d2bd.description: The holder of this digital badge has been accredited by the Alliance of Information and Referral Systems (AIRS at www.airs.org). AIRS Accreditation is for programs operating within the community/social service/health sectors that have proven their ability to meet the international AIRS Standards and Quality Indicators for Professional Information and Referral (www.airs.org/standards). The process is overseen by the AIRS Accreditation Commission that operates independently of the AIRS Board.
dcdddb46-935d-4fd9-9991-6d7c1b11d2bd.name: AIRS Accreditation Program

issuer.summary: issued by Alliance of Information and Referral Systems

entity.name: Alliance of Information and Referral Systems

badge_template_activities.title: AIRS Accreditation has five core elements: (1) a Consultative Review of overall policies, processes and procedures, (2) an online Community Survey of organizations within their resource database, (3) an online Resource Database Review,  (4) A Secret Shopper testing of the direct client service, and (5) an Onsite Review.  Reaccreditation takes place every five years, and requires the successful completion of the full process.

122ce88e-782a-4078-9810-ac69d1f8213f.description: The Alliance of Information and Referral Systems is the professional membership association for community Information and Referral (I&R) serving the nonprofit and government sectors. b45686ab-8f47-426e-be8d-9298e5bb87b1.description: The AIRS I&R Coaching Certificate represents a special recognition for experienced I&R practitioners who have demonstrated professional expertise in performance-based coaching. It is only available to existing holders of AIRS Certification. Holders have a strong understanding of the role of coaching; the quality elements of I&R; the required knowledge, aptitude and attitude; coaching and communication techniques; the development of individual performance plans; and individual learning styles.
b45686ab-8f47-426e-be8d-9298e5bb87b1.name: AIRS I&R Coaching Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Alliance of Information and Referral Systems

entity.name: Alliance of Information and Referral Systems

badge_template_activities.title: All candidates must complete and review four AIRS online courses and webinar presentations. A final online exam must be completed to earn the designation.
